thread.title: REPORT: Michael Flynn Told FBI in Interview That He Didn’t Discuss Sanctions With Russian Ambassador
thread.title_full: REPORT: Michael Flynn Told FBI in Interview That He Didn’t Discuss Sanctions With Russian Ambassador

author: Justin Baragona
title: REPORT: Michael Flynn Told FBI in Interview That He Didn’t Discuss Sanctions With Russian Ambassador
text:
REPORT: Michael Flynn Told FBI in Interview That He Didn’t Discuss Sanctions With Russian Ambassador by Justin Baragona | 7:15   
According to a report by the Washington Post this afternoon , former National Security Adviser Michael Flynn denied discussing sanctions imposed by the Obama Administration with the Russian ambassador while being interviewed by the FBI last month. 
As the Post noted, Flynn telling the FBI that he didn’t bring that up when intercepted communications show the opposite could place Flynn in legal hot water. 
The Jan. 24 interview potentially puts Flynn in legal jeopardy, as lying to the FBI is a felony, but any decision to prosecute would ultimately lie with the Justice Department. Some officials said bringing a case could prove difficult in part because Flynn may attempt to parse the definition of sanctions. 
Following reports that Flynn had discussed sanctions during December phone calls with the Russian ambassador, Flynn resigned on Monday night. President Donald Trump has said he asked for the resignation due to the fact that Flynn had misled Vice President Mike Pence over the content of those conversations. 
Over the past couple of days, Trump has railed against the press over Flynn’s ouster, calling the ex-NSA a “wonderful man” who was treated “very unfairly” while claiming that the retired general did nothing illegal. The president has also taken to condemning leaks from his administration and the intelligence community that have been the basis for many of these news reports.
